head.citation-title: Lateral resistance of T-shape barrette pile in Bangkok subsoils
head.abstracts: The large and long bored piles are general used as the pile foundation for high-rise building, bridge and expressway in Bangkok city. However, in case of high loading capacity requirement (over than 20000 KN) in the limited area such as the elevated train project, the use of barrette pile make a better alternative than bored pile. The lateral resistance of the barrette pile is very strong in the longer side and very weal in the narrow side. The T-shape barrette pile is, therefore, was proposed to be a alternative deep foundation to support not only high vertical load but also high lateral loading. The pile load test was carried out to verify the lateral resistance of the T-shape barrette pile and bored pile in Bangkok subsoils. This is to resist lateral load from wind, seismic and other lateral force of the high-rise project. Two set of tested T-shape barrette and bored piles were constructed in Bangkok subsoils with pile tip penetrated in the very dense sand at about 55 m. depth below ground surface. The instrumentation such as inclinometer, strain gauge and settlement points were installed in the piles and in the ground. The behavior of barrette pile and bored pile was compared and discussed. The performance of the T-shape barrette pile and bored piles were predicted by 3D finite element analysis. The 3D predicted values were compared with field measurements.
